info.title: Peatio Admin API v2
info.description: Admin API high privileged API with RBAC.

post.description: Accepts adjustment and creates operations or reject adjustment.

201.description: Accepts adjustment and creates operations or reject adjustment.

get.description: Get adjustment by ID

200.description: Get adjustment by ID

get.description: Get all adjustments, result is paginated.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch.If set, only entities FROM the time will be retrieved.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: An integer represents the seconds elapsed since Unix epoch.If set, only entities BEFORE the time will be retrieved.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned paginations. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify the page of paginated results.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: If set, returned values will be sorted in specific order, defaults to 'asc'.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Name of the field, which result will be ordered by.

200.description: Get all adjustments, result is paginated.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: If present, only sell orders (asks) or buy orders (bids) will be cancelled.

get.description: Get all orders, result is paginated.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy,where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quotecurrency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets canbe found at /api/v2/markets.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: Price for each unit. e.g.If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 usd, the price is '3000.0'

parameters.name: origin_volume
parameters.description: The amount user want to sell/buy.An order could be partially executed,e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order,left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0',its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.

parameters.name: ordering

validator_uid.description: Unique adjustment validator identifier in database.

creator_uid.description: Unique adjustment creator identifier in database.

created_at.description: The datetime when operation was created.

updated_at.description: The datetime when operation was updated.

Adjustment.description: Get all adjustments, result is paginated.

code.description: The Account code which this operation related to.

created_at.description: The datetime when operation was created.

Operation.description: Returns liabilities as a paginated collection.

price.description: Price for each unit. e.g.If you want to sell/buy 1 btc at 3000 usd, the price is '3000.0'

avg_price.description: Average execution price, average of price in trades.

state.description: One of 'wait', 'done', or 'cancel'.An order in 'wait' is an active order, waiting fulfillment;a 'done' order is an order fulfilled;'cancel' means the order has been canceled.

market.description: The market in which the order is placed, e.g. 'btcusd'.All available markets can be found at /api/v2/markets.

created_at.description: Order create time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Order updated time in iso8601 format.

origin_volume.description: The amount user want to sell/buy.An order could be partially executed,e.g. an order sell 5 btc can be matched with a buy 3 btc order,left 2 btc to be sold; in this case the order's volume would be '5.0',its remaining_volume would be '2.0', its executed volume is '3.0'.

Order.description: Get all orders, result is paginated.

height.description: The number of blocks preceding a particular block on blockchain.

created_at.description: Blockchain created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Blockchain updated time in iso8601 format.

Blockchain.description: Get a trade with detailed information.

min_confirmations.description: Number of confirmations required for confirming deposit or withdrawal

blockchain_key.description: Associated blockchain key which will perform transactions synchronization for currency.

subunits.description: Fraction of the basic monetary unit.

created_at.description: Currency created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Currency updated time in iso8601 format.

id.description: Unique market id. It's always in the form of xxxyyy,where xxx is the base currency code, yyy is the quotecurrency code, e.g. 'btcusd'. All available markets canbe found at /api/v2/markets.

state.description: Market state defines if user can see/trade on current market.

created_at.description: Market created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Market updated time in iso8601 format.

Market.description: Get all markets, result is paginated.

created_at.description: Wallet created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Wallet updated time in iso8601 format.

Wallet.description: Get all wallets, result is paginated.

created_at.description: The datetime when deposit was created.

completed_at.description: The datetime when deposit was completed.

updated_at.description: The datetime when deposit was updated.

Deposit.description: Get all deposits, result is paginated.

rid.description: The beneficiary ID or wallet address on the Blockchain.

completed_at.description: The datetime when withdraw was completed.

Withdraw.description: Get all withdraws, result is paginated.

name.description: Human rememberable name which refer beneficiary.

data.description: Bank Account details for fiat Beneficiary in JSON format.For crypto it's blockchain address.

state.description: Defines either beneficiary active - user can use it to withdraw moneyor pending - requires beneficiary activation with pin.

created_at.description: Trade create time in iso8601 format.

taker_type.description: Trade taker order type (sell or buy).

Trade.description: Get all trades, result is paginated.

created_at.description: Member created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Member updated time in iso8601 format.

Member.description: Get all members, result is paginated.

id.description: Unique trading fee table identifier in database.

group.description: Member group for define maker/taker fee.

market_id.description: Market id for define maker/taker fee.

created_at.description: Trading fee table created time in iso8601 format.

updated_at.description: Trading fee table updated time in iso8601 format.

TradingFee.description: Returns trading_fees table as paginated collection
